definition: anchor (TV)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
newsreader/anchor

sentences.english: I heard that the anchorman of the DBD TV network's evening news got fired.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說DBD電視網的晚間新聞主播被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: North Korea's state television newscaster announced such propaganda will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 北韓國營電視臺新聞主播宣佈這種宣傳不會被容忍。

sentences.english: This tape, work of former Raccoon 7 anchorwoman Terri Morales.
sentences.chinese: 這盤帶子，是前浣熊市7頻道主播泰瑞莫拉斯拍攝的。

sentences.english: Then one thing led to another and now I am a news anchor myself.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣，機緣巧合的，我就當上了新聞主播。

sentences.english: Yellow Ying, the new Chinese television station Cantonese news host broadcasts concurrently reporter.
sentences.chinese: 黃穎，新唐人電視臺粵語新聞主播兼記者。

sentences.english: DJ – The most handsome was Ah Loke, most beautiful was Xiao Lan.
sentences.chinese: 電臺主播，最帥的是阿陸，最漂亮的是沈小嵐。

sentences.english: Radio and television anchors usually appear on more than one newscast per day.
sentences.chinese: 廣播電視的主播通常要在每天的新聞節目中多次出現。

sentences.english: The news anchor has an oval face, and is very cameragenic.
sentences.chinese: 這位新聞主播有張瓜子臉，在鏡頭前很上相。

sentences.english: I heard that BCB's evening news anchor was canned.
sentences.chinese: 電視網的晚間新聞主播被炒魷魚。

sentences.english: BIGTV masters star broadcaster, Ann in yong.
The anchorman of the BBC network's evening news got fired.
sentences.chinese: 聽說BBC電視網的晚間新聞主播被炒了魷魚。

sentences.english: Ying Wong, an anchor and reporter of Cantonese from New Chinese TV station.
sentences.chinese: 黃穎，新唐人電視臺粵語新聞主播兼記者。

sentences.english: But only one newscaster is the host.
sentences.chinese: 但是隻有一個新聞播音員主播。

sentences.english: The news anchor recaps the headlines at the end of the news broadcast.
sentences.chinese: 新聞主播在新聞的最後把主要內容概述一下。

live broadcast (not recorded)/direct Internet broadcasting/(agriculture) direct seeding
(of two people in different locations) to sing or otherwise perform together using communications technology

player (of a game)/enthusiast (audio, model planes etc)
obscenities/lewd talk
bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
Kuaishou, Chinese social video sharing app
to cheat in an online game (abbr. for 開外掛|开外挂[kai1 wai4 gua4])/(coll.) unbelievably good
barrage (military)/"bullet screen", function which allows viewers to post on-screen comments in videos, movies etc in real time/danmaku (video game subgenre)
(slang) anti-fan
Internet celebrity
